result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Marathon County Victim Waiver of No Contact Bond Condition- S.H. (restrictions). Will allow contact with Heather Hink EXCEPT for in-person contact at S.H.'s residence. Police escort for her personal items also.

Pre-trial conference on August 24, 2022 at 10:20 am.
Final pre-trial on October 14, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Jury Trial on November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): S.T.H.; Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence; Wausau PD.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except valid prescriptions taken as prescribed.  Prints and photograph.

3:05 PM 
Clerk: Amy. 

State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen.   Defendant appears in person, pro se (with Ray Lesieur, Landlord).

Date and time set for initial appearance. 
COURT directs defendant to take criminal complaint home; Defendant is not understanding charges.  
COURT reads complaint.  Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
PLEA: Not guilty by Court. 

COURT ORDERS: $250.00 signature bond.  

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): S.T.H. 
- Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence; Wausau PD.  
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except valid prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- Prints and photograph. 

PTC:  8/24/22 at 10:20 a.m. 
FPT/TP:  10/14/22 at 11:45 a.m. 
JT:  11/08/22 at 9:00 a.m. 

Adj:  3:10 p.m. 

Branch 4 case.
